security: Disclosing the identity of Michael Stratton as someone providing information on Court Wood's activities could jeopardize his safety or future ability to provide information. Stratton asks, “What action, if any, should I take in regard to my relationship with Court and his father?” This reveals Stratton's source relationship.
summary: Michael Stratton informs Jack Kennedy of Court Wood's involvement in the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE and requests guidance on his relationship with Court and his father.
summary_one_paragraph: On May 8, 1961, Michael Stratton wrote to Jack Kennedy regarding Court Wood, son of attorney Foster Wood, who Stratton previously reported as having pro-Castro sentiments. Stratton notes that Court Wood is now actively involved in organizing a local chapter of the FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE, lecturing to students in eastern cities such as Baltimore, Philadelphia, and New York, and meeting with "Interested groups." Stratton mentions meeting David Lacterman and Walt MacDonwald, who are also active in this committee, and seeks guidance on how to manage his relationship with Court and his father.
title: Report on Court Wood's Activities with FAIR PLAY FOR CUBA COMMITTEE
